info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 17 at 3:56AM EST until December 19 at 4:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ MONDAY TO 4 AM EST /3 AM CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts in the heavier snow bands. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph causing blowing snow. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana and southwest Michigan. * WHEN...From 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ Monday to 4 AM EST /3 AM CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become difficult. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility in the heavier snow bands. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sharply colder air will help produce heavy lake effect snow bands Monday. Temperatures fall below freezing and cause road conditions to deteriorate, especially in the heavier snow bands. Strong winds will cause blowing snow and increased travel difficulties.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visibilities will be greatly reduced in the vicinity of lake effect snow showers.
